Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a light-brown pottery vessel, fabric has a black core, interior speckled with a dark-brown resinous deposit, exterior covered with a light-brown slip and remains of five lines of Coptic text written in black ink, containing a receipt.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.182)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36423) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36423)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 281 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
Miscellaneous number: SB XVIII 13469 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
